name: St. Aristarchus
summary: Aristarchus was a Macedonian from Thessalonica who became a faithful companion of Paul the Apostle. He is mentioned in the Acts of the Apostles as one of Paul's traveling companions and was with Paul during the riot in Ephesus. He accompanied Paul on his journey to Rome and was imprisoned with him. Paul refers to him as a 'fellow worker' and 'fellow prisoner.' According to tradition, he became bishop of Thessalonica and was martyred during the reign of Nero.
